basics.name: Kevin Li
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Software engineer with a passion for problem solving, an eye for detail, and a strong mathematics background. Well organized, prompt, attentive and works well within a team or on solo projects. Interested in being part of innovative and technically challenging projects. Always looking for ways to improve as an engineer, eager to learn, and responsive to criticism.

work.summary: Offerpop's Visual UGC Marketing SaaS platform empowers brands to encourage and leverage user generated content at every stage of the buyer journey, improving marketing performance. Leading brands and agencies use Offerpop’s Visual UGC platform to create campaigns and promotions from a library of templates to inspire the creation of quality UGC, manage and leverage UGC across marketing channels, and build consumer profiles to improve segmentation and targeting. The company is headquartered in New York City, with offices in London.
highlights: Technologies: Python, Django, Selenium, Javascript, AngularJS, ReactJS, NodeJS, CSS, Less, Bootstrap, Material UI, HTML, Apache, Vagrant, Docker, MySQL, MongoDB
Create new features in the platform to increase the value being delivered to clients and improve their user experience.
Improve the platform's client onboarding process and user interface experience to drive higher engagement and retention within the platform.
Modernize the platform by adopting modern technologies such as ReactJS and Redux.
Visually refreshing the platform by building UI based on Material UI's design philosophy.
Maintain, update, improve, and refactor existing legacy code.
Write user acceptance and unit tests.
JIRA, Confluence, Slack, and GitHub is used to manage and organize workflow processes.
Travis and Jenkins is used for continuous integration testing.
Work together with a team of software engineers.

work.summary: PivotalPath is an innovator and leader in the hedge fund advisory space. PivotalPath's business model is a unique and industry first combination between a traditional hedge fund advisory business and modern technology. PivotalPath's platform regularly provides information and analysis on over 700 hedge fund managers to their institutional clients. Their clients have assets under advisory totaling in excess of $6 billion dollars. PivotalPath aims to deliver qualitative due diligence, accurate information, and quality analysis on more hedge funds than any competitor at a better value. PivotalPath accomplishes these goals and remains scalable by leveraging proprietary methodologies and modern technology.
highlights: Help build and design the codebase from scratch.
Technologies: Python, Django, Java, Javascript, CSS, Bootstrap, HTML, MySQL, SQLite, Apache, Nginx, Amazon Web Services.
Work closely with the financial team to understand what tools they need for streamlining their research effort.
Develop an outward facing platform for clients to access and interact with the financial team's research efforts.
Develop an internal facing platform for the financial team to organize and manage their research process.
Setup and maintain the cloud infrastructure responsible for hosting PivotalPath's platform services.
JIRA, Confluence, HipChat, and GitHub is used to manage and organize workflow processes.
Work together with a team of software engineers.

work.summary: The Hospital Information Services Department of Maimonides Medical Center was responsible for maintaining the medical records of the patients at the Maimonides Medical Center. This included tasks such as identifying incomplete records, ensuring the results of tests and procedures were associated with the correct record, and acquiring the necessary approval or signatures from the appropriate physicians.
highlights: Maintain and organiz medical records.
Identify medical records that were missing physician signatures or reviews.
Assist physicians in locating their patient's medical records.
Handle sensitive information daily with care and professionalism.
